com.camerontec.catalys.server.schedule

Interface ITimeSpec

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TimeSpec

    public interface ITimeSpec
    Represents a time or set of times such as "every Friday".

    This is more than a passive container for a time specification. It can also fire an event when the time it represents arrives. Only one listener to that event is allowed. The setListener(com.camerontec.catalys.server.schedule.IScheduledTask) method specifies that listener.

      • getNextScheduledTime

        long getNextScheduledTime()
        Returns the next scheduled time of this TimeSpec.

        Value returned is standard milliseconds since 1/1/1970. If the time spec is not currently scheduled, returns -1.

        Returns:
        Time of next scheduled event or -1 if none.

      • getTimeZone

        TimeZone getTimeZone()

      • isMatch

        boolean isMatch(Date time)
        True if the given time (an absolute GMT time) matches this TimeSpec. To match the time needs to be converted to the timezone used by this timespec and then compared against its various values, taking account of wild cards.
        Parameters:
        time - Time to match against the TimeSpec.
        Returns:
        True if the given time is compatible with this TimeSpec.

      • isNextEnabled

        boolean isNextEnabled()
        True if the next scheduled event is enabled.

        If not, it will still occur but will its listener will not be notified. However, this flag will then be automatically set to true - thus enabling the new next event.

        Returns:
        True (default) if next event is enabled.

      • isRepetitive

        boolean isRepetitive()
        True if this time spec is expected to reoccur.
        Returns:
        True it reoccurs.

      • setNextEnabled

        void setNextEnabled(boolean nextEnabled)
        Determine if the next scheduled event is enabled.
        Parameters:
        nextEnabled - True if next event is enabled.
        See Also:
        isNextEnabled()

      • setListener

        void setListener(IScheduledTask scheduledTask)
